eventName: Such is the Joy of Our Reunion
storyInfo: Blaze and Leizi meet up again, and the two decide to head to the Feast of a Hundred Delicacies. Elsewhere, the time has come for the Yanese imperial court to decide on the matter of the bestial Sui. The True Lung is set to announce his verdict at the Feast.

attributes.content: Your friend left so soon? She won't even stay for dinner?
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: Mm... she had urgent business. She couldn't stay.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: Even as a child, you never brought friends over. Here I thought I could drop in to see what she's like.
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: I don't know if we even—count as friends, really...
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: Seeing the dejected Ning Yin, the old man tries to think of something to say, but can't. He simply reaches over and brushes a leaf off her shoulder.
Almost time to move. Plenty of things still on your plate, eh?
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: What about you, Grandfather?
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: Heheh, for days I was all raring to go home. Now that we're about to, I look around at our little garden and I think 'oh, if only I could stay'.
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: Do you remember? It was here in this pavilion we laid out some sand, and grabbed a stick, and I taught you how to write one stroke at a time.
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: You said by next year, you'd be writing all the estate couplets for us. Then you spent two months with me learning, and after that you had to give up.
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: But by next year, you really did write me a couplet.
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: 'Bountiful blooms and a full moon; may joy last forever.'
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: I'm surprised you still remember, Grandfather.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: How could I forget... Ah, another year, another Mid-Autumn. How quickly the days pass.
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: The two of us haven't chewed the fat like this in the longest, have we? Grandfather to granddaughter.
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: Mm. I've been out constantly, and you're always occupied with guests. We hardly have the chance to meet.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: The whole family's leaving the capital, after all. Quite the headache.
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: But things will settle down once we're back in Langyi, and we'll have plenty of time to chat along the way.
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: Are you almost done writing that book of yours?
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: Grandfather, I don't... think I can go back to Langyi with you.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: When did you make up your mind?
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: Ning Yin shakes her head softly. She falls a few steps back.
You're returning home, Grandfather, like a leaf returns to its root. It's human nature, the whole family sympathizes. But the journey is meandering enough to make us worried.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: The Nings are bursting with talent. Everyone's work forms a cornerstone of Yan. Compared to them, I really am the lone choice to accompany you back.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: But frankly, I was always a distant orphan from Langyi anyway. It was because you took such pity on me that I could spend these decades at the Ning manor.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: If I go now to Langyi, I go back to where my long-gone parents once lived.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: That was your thinking... when you asked to accompany me home?
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: Grandfather... that was my thinking.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: It all seemed to fall into place. I almost managed to convince myself.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: But I've spent the last few days on a farewell tour of sorts around Baizao's streets, so I can finish up the Baizao Cuisine & Food Culture somehow.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: And I realized, all my memories are of this city.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: I can clearly recall what year we planted that persimmon tree in the courtyard, and when its fruits make for the best wine.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: And every restaurant of every road and alley, and what their chefs are like, and how many different ways you can cook each dish.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: All of a sudden, it hit me that... this very city, moreso than the Ning manor, feels like my home.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: *sigh*...
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: ...That's on me. That's on me for not asking you how you feel. I've been nothing but me this whole time.
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: Grandfather, you're my one and only family. You've always been since I was little.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: I really did want to go back home with you at first, but the reason I'm set on staying in Baizao now... is you as well, Grandfather.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: Is it?
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: Mm-hm.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: When I first joined the Imperial Historical Cabinet to compile annals, there was one thing I could never puzzle out.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: At some specific point in Yan's millennia of history, out of nowhere, the written word proliferated and education became for all. Even the earliest of the tablets we were studying only went back to that period.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: So I thought, in that period, someone must have pushed for those changes. But I flipped through practically all the material we had, and I couldn't find a single clue.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: I had this strange feeling that, there in Yan's history, one person seemed to be missing.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: Then one day, I met someone strange at a Go club, who told me the story of 'that person'.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: I thought he was just a yarn-spinning storyteller at first, but as I further researched, I gradually found all his stories to be corroborated.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: According to him, 'she' was a gentle person who gave her heart and soul, her blood and sweat to the wellbeing of the people. And she gave too much... But how could someone as good as her fail to leave her name in our annals?
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: That was when I realized that a history book isn't a container, but a sieve. The stories that stay behind are few and far between.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: Grandfather... I want to record your story. But then I look back, and it dawns on me that for all the years I've spent with you, I can't even write with any clarity about...
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: About what—kind of person you are.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: Ning Yin finally lifts her head, and meets the old man's eyes.
She waits for his reply, his answer to her unspoken question.
She's waited for so long.
Who goes there!
attributes.name: Judicial Officer A

attributes.content: Who goes where?
attributes.name: Judicial Officer B

attributes.content: Tch... Thought I heard something.
attributes.name: Judicial Officer A

attributes.content: It's all the bizarre cases these days. Makes me feel like someone's going to barge in any moment and wreak havoc.
attributes.name: Judicial Officer A

attributes.content: This is the Judicial Review Office. What kind of miscreant would break in here?
attributes.name: Judicial Officer B

attributes.content: Quit jumping at ghosts. Guard duty's almost over, and then we can clock out and head home.
attributes.name: Judicial Officer B

attributes.content: Just wait a sec and then enter through the front... say you're here to report a case, then find a floor map on the way to the waiting room...
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: The window in the waiting room yesterday faces north, the Judicial entrance faces south, behind is a high perimeter wall.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Lin Qingyan's office is sec—third floor... get out the window, climb up the sprinkler pipes, and no one should notice me.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Ta ma de! Once I find her I'm gonna sock her in the...!
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Who's there?!
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Lin Qingyan?!
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Blaze?!
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: What are you here for?!
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: What am I here for? I'm here to get YOU back!
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Where'd your old court uniform go?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: I resigned.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Then went back to the restaurant, couldn't find you, and worried you might be up to something stupid, so thank you for confirming that fear.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Now let's find somewhere else to talk!
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: You're telling me that all those years, Gu Quan was staying at the Ning manor?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: But how did you find out...
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Never you mind that. Now, can you tell me exactly what that means?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Minister Ning's involvement in the Gu Quan case runs deeper than I ever thought. He was clearly hiding something in his previous testimony.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: I did suspect he was the perpetrator, but going by Mo Bufu's testimony, when Gu Quan was sent to death row in the fallout of the old case, Ning Shu was the one who got him out. Knowing that...
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: He wouldn't have a motive to try and get him killed again.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: And the most key thing... I had no idea before that Yu Cheng had contact with Gu Quan so early on.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Whatever's connecting this string of events, it's likely more complicated than anything I've imagined.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: See, I'm still curious. All those years ago, my dad came to Baizao on his own—and what the hell for?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Yes, that's the key question...
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: (Blaze has no clue about the two lives Gu Quan lived... If he was a fall guy in that incident, then why would he return to Baizao a dozen years after the fact and plant himself in the middle of the maelstrom?)
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: (Ning Shu's position, Yu Cheng's scheme... We still can't draw an outline around any of these questions.)
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: (How should I let Blaze know...)
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Hey, you know I can tell that look on your face?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: C'mon. What's our next move, exactly?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Blaze, about yesterday...
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Forget about it. I know you 'it's-my-duty' types get the urge to do a little weird stuff now and then. Not my circus, I'm not arguing.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Just don't ever tell me any stupid crap like 'I'm sending you back for your safety' again, because—
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: You're still trying to ditch me!?!
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Blaze, trust me, I will see this case through to the end... but you can't stick around in Baizao any longer than this.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Do as I said. Leave within two days, head to the Lungmen office first. But you can't stay there for too long either, so once you're reorganized, get back on the road straight away and leave Yan as soon as—
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Over my dead body.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: You don't trust me to keep investigating?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: I mean, I do, but you're out of a rank, you're out of a job, how are you gonna investigate?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: I'll think of something.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: If Yu Cheng can resign and investigate in secret, then so can—
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: I have an idea.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Let's do this thing a little more thoroughly.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: What's your plan?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Blaze pulls a letter from her pocket.
It's the chance Mo Bufu gave her, and now it's both of their chances.
Not like we're gonna get anywhere just running around town.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: We'll head to the Feast of a Hundred Delicacies, go straight to the True Lung, and ask him to explain all this.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Your Imperial Majesty, the Ministry of Rites has drafted the official list of attendees for the Feast of a Hundred Delicacies.
attributes.name: Grand Tutor

attributes.content: To mark the occasion, Victoria, Leithanien, Laterano and other such nations have sent us their envoys with letters of celebration.
attributes.name: Grand Tutor

attributes.content: For Your Imperial Majesty's perusal.
attributes.name: Grand Tutor

attributes.content: *cough* *cough*... *cough* *hack*...
attributes.name: Grand Commandant

attributes.content: Your Imperial Majesty... the Ministry of War and Sui Regulator have finished drawing up joint battleplans.
attributes.name: Grand Commandant

attributes.content: Also for Your Imperial Majesty's... *cough* *cough*... perusal.
attributes.name: Grand Commandant

attributes.content: The Ministry of Revenue was not consulted on this battle's drain on labor and fiscal resources, nor on the postwar reparations. How were these battleplans drafted?
attributes.name: Grand Tutor

attributes.content: I know you and the Ministry of Revenue are both very busy. The Ministry of War simply went to some small pains working out the manpower, the funding, the ration, and even the Ministry of Engineering's postwar repair expenses.
attributes.name: Grand Commandant

attributes.content: And now you can read together with His Majesty, since we're having an audience and all.
attributes.name: Grand Commandant

attributes.content: Logistics are calculable, but how many of Yan's people will bleed in this war? Is that a bill you can work out so easily?
attributes.name: Grand Tutor

attributes.content: So the Grand Tutor means to say, if you can't work it out, then no need to try?
attributes.name: Grand Commandant

attributes.content: It's autumn... How are the harvests in the north?
attributes.name: Voice Behind the Curtain

attributes.content: Dahuang has resumed production ASAP following the disaster. Our harvest this year is more or less on par with previous years.
attributes.name: Grand Tutor

attributes.content: In that case... what about next year?
attributes.name: Voice Behind the Curtain

attributes.content: Your Imperial Majesty...
attributes.name: Grand Tutor

attributes.content: A life measured in years, yet the stress feels ancient. We're running out of time.
attributes.name: Voice Behind the Curtain

attributes.content: This involves the livelihoods of all Yan's people. I ask that Your Imperial Majesty reconsider.
attributes.name: Grand Tutor

attributes.content: Grand Tutor, the Ministries have long discussed everything worth discussing. It's about time we made up our minds.
attributes.name: Grand Commandant

attributes.content: His Majesty's decree is made. We simply await his proclamation at the Feast of a Hundred Delicacies.
attributes.name: Grand Commandant

attributes.content: It's growing late. It looks to rain.
attributes.name: Voice Behind the Curtain

attributes.content: ...The two of you can leave.
attributes.name: Voice Behind the Curtain

attributes.content: May we be excused.
attributes.name: Grand Tutor & Grand Commandant

attributes.content: The man behind the curtain lifts his gaze—
In this desolate palace, three banquet seats lay set out in a row to his side, and one of them is truly showing its age.
Faintly, a sigh.
Aiyo, aiyo... Trust this rain to come from nowhere, I'm soaked...
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: Autumn drizzles and cold snaps... We'll be out of fresh vegetables in a few days at this rate. I didn't even get to rustle up this year's winter clothes...
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: Chef, I think we're forced to start our winter pickles now. Get your mess of stuff out of the storehouse as soon as—
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: Chef...?
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: Blaze? Xingzhu? Where'd everybody go...?
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: The ever-lively kitchen is presently deserted, all the cookware tidied away. The cramped space seems a good bit wider like this.
The only presence is a pot of soup boiling on the stove.
